meaning: She abandoned her plan halfway.
partOfSpeech: 타동사. 목적어(계획, 습관 등)가 꼭 필요함.
example: abandon'은 어떤 계획이나 행동을 중단하거나 포기한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The company had to abandon the project due to a lack of funding.
sentence: He decided to ____ the old plan.

meaning: We must abide by the rules.
partOfSpeech: 자동사 + 전치사 by. ‘규칙을 따르다’ 형태 고정.
example: abide'는 (특히 'abide by'의 형태로) 규칙, 법률, 결정 등을 받아들이고 따른다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n All employees must abide by the company's code of conduct.
sentence: You must ____ by the company rules.

meaning: He accepted the invitation.
example: accept'는 (제안, 초대, 사과 등을) 기꺼이 받아들인다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We are pleased to accept your job offer.
sentence: I can’t ____ this offer right now.

meaning: Only managers can access the file.
partOfSpeech: 타동사. 전치사 없이 목적어 바로 사용(⚠ to 안 씀).
example: access'는 장소에 들어가거나 정보/시스템을 사용할 수 있는 '허가'나 '권리'를 의미하는 명사입니다.\r\n You need a key card to access the restricted area.
sentence: Please use your ID to ____ the system.

meaning: The hotel can accommodate 200 guests.
example: accommodate'는 누군가의 필요나 욕구를 충족시키거나 편의를 제공한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The hotel can accommodate requests for non-smoking rooms.
sentence: The hotel can ____ up to 200 guests.

meaning: She accomplished her goal.
example: accomplish'는 노력을 통해 (어떤 과업이나 목표)를 성공적으로 완료한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The sales team worked hard to accomplish their quarterly targets.
sentence: She finally ____ her goal last year.

meaning: This explains how we account for the results.
partOfSpeech: 자동사 + 전치사 for. ‘이유를 설명하다’ 고정 구문.
example: account'는 은행 거래 기록(계좌)이나, 비용 처리를 위한 회사 장부(계정) 등을 의미하는 명사입니다.\r\n Please charge the expenses to the company account.
sentence: He gave a clear ____ of what happened.

meaning: He accumulated a lot of experience.
example: accumulate'는 (특히 시간을 두고) 조금씩 모으거나 쌓아 올린다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n Employees can accumulate vacation days over time.
sentence: Dust will ____ if you don’t clean often.

meaning: They acknowledged their mistake. / He acknowledged that it was true.
example: acknowledge'는 편지나 이메일 등을 '받았음을 알리다' 혹은 (사실이나 중요성을) '인정하다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n Please acknowledge receipt of this email by end of day.
sentence: We should ____ his great effort.

meaning: She acts as a leader.
example: act'는 어떤 목적을 가진 구체적인 '행동'이나 '조치'를 의미하는 명사입니다.\r\n Taking swift act in an emergency is crucial.
sentence: Let’s ____ quickly before it’s too late.

meaning: You must adapt to change. / He adapted the book for TV.
partOfSpeech: 자동사(to적응) & 타동사(변형) 두 용법 모두 존재.
example: adapt'는 (새로운 상황이나 용도에) 맞도록 변경하거나 조정한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We must adapt our marketing strategy to meet changing customer demands.
sentence: You must ____ to a new environment.

meaning: He addressed the audience.
example: address'는 (문제나 사안을) 공식적으로 다루거나 해결하려 한다는 의미, 혹은 청중에게 '연설하다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The manager will address the team's concerns in the meeting.
sentence: We need to ____ this issue in the report.

meaning: The paint adheres to the wall.
partOfSpeech: 자동사 + 전치사 to. 물리적·추상적 결속 모두 가능.
example: adhere'는 (규칙, 정책, 신념 등을) 굳게 지키고 따른다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n All staff must adhere to the new safety regulations.
sentence: All staff must ____ to safety rules.

meaning: He adjusted to the new environment. / She adjusted the mirror.
example: adjust'는 더 나은 상태나 결과물을 위해 (계획, 일정, 기계 등을) 약간 변경하거나 맞춘다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We may need to adjust the project timeline.
sentence: You can ____ the seat if it feels too low.

meaning: I admire your courage.
example: admire'는 (누군가의 자질이나 성과에 대해) 존경심을 갖고 훌륭하다고 생각한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We admire your dedication to customer satisfaction.
sentence: I really ____ her for her hard work.

meaning: He admitted his mistake. / She admitted making a mistake.
example: admit'는 (주로 좋지 않은 사실이나 실수를) 마지못해 사실이라고 받아들이거나 시인한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The company admitted that the product had a minor defect.
sentence: He refused to ____ his mistake.

meaning: He advised me to stay calm.
partOfSpeech: 목적어 뒤에 to부정사 목적보어가 자주 옴.
example: advise'는 (전문적인 지식을 바탕으로) 어떻게 해야 할지에 대해 공식적인 '조언'이나 '권고'를 한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We advise clients to review their contracts carefully.
sentence: She will ____ you on how to solve it.

meaning: The weather affects our mood.
partOfSpeech: 타동사. 감정·상황·결과 등에 영향. ‘on’ 쓰지 않음.
example: affect'는 (어떤 사람, 사물, 상황에) 변화를 가져오거나 '영향'을 준다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The new policy will affect all employees in the marketing department.
sentence: The new rule will ____ all employees.

meaning: We can’t afford to lose time.
example: afford'는 (주로 'can/cannot'과 함께 쓰여) 시간적, 금전적으로 (어떤 것을 하거나 가질) '여유'가 된다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We cannot afford to miss this deadline.
sentence: We can’t ____ a new car this month.

meaning: This policy aims to reduce costs. / He aimed at the target.
partOfSpeech: 자동사(at + 목표) / 타동사(to + 목적) 둘 다 가능.
example: aim'은 (어떤 결과나 성과를) 달성하는 것을 '목표로 한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n This training program aims to improve leadership skills.
sentence: We ____ to finish the project by Friday.

meaning: The manager alerted staff to the problem.
partOfSpeech: 목적어(사람) + 전치사 to + 내용 구조 가능.
example: alert'는 (형용사) 위험을 인지하고 대비하는 상태, (동사) 위험이나 문제를 누군가에게 알린다는 의미입니다. (제공된 목록에는 adjective로 되어있으나, 토익에서는 동사로도 자주 쓰입니다.)\r\n The system will alert the user if an error occurs.
sentence: Please ____ me if you see any danger.

meaning: The medicine alleviated the pain.
example: alleviate'는 (문제나 고통의 정도를) 덜어주거나 가볍게 한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The new measures are intended to alleviate traffic congestion downtown.
sentence: This medicine can ____ your pain.

meaning: The company allocated funds to the project.
partOfSpeech: 목적어 + to + 대상. 수동형 자주 쓰임.
example: allocate'는 (자원, 자금, 업무 등을) 특정 목적이나 사람에게 나누어 배정한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The manager will allocate the budget for the new project.
sentence: Funds were ____ to each department.

meaning: The law allows citizens to vote.
example: allow'는 어떤 일이 일어나도록 '허용'하거나 가능하게 한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The company does not allow smoking in the office.
sentence: The manager didn’t ____ him to enter.

meaning: They announced that a new product would launch.
partOfSpeech: ‘to’ 없이 목적어 바로. ‘사람’이 목적어일 수 없음.
example: announce'는 (중요한 정보를) 대중에게 공식적으로 알린다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The CEO will announce the quarterly earnings next week.
sentence: They will ____ the winner tomorrow.

meaning: We anticipate an increase in sales.
partOfSpeech: 동명사 목적어 가능. 미래 예상 의미.
example: anticipate'는 (어떤 일이 일어날 것을) 미리 생각하고 대비하거나 기대한다는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We anticipate a significant increase in online sales this quarter.
sentence: We ____ that sales will increase soon.

meaning: He apologized to his boss for the mistake.
example: apologize'는 (자신의 실수나 잘못에 대해) 공식적으로 유감을 표현하고 '사과한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We apologize for the delay in shipping your order.
sentence: He will ____ for being late.

meaning: The commercial appeals to young people.
example: appeal'은 (사람의 마음을 끄는) '매력'이나 '흥미'를 의미하는 명사입니다. (법률 용어로 '항소'라는 뜻도 있음)\r\n The product's new design has a wide appeal to younger customers.
sentence: The movie will ____ to a young audience.

meaning: I really appreciate your help.
example: appreciate'는 (누군가의 도움이나 노력에 대해) '감사하다'는 마음을 표현할 때 쓰는 동사입니다.\r\n We appreciate your feedback on our new service.
sentence: I really ____ your help on this matter.

meaning: She applied for a job. / Apply to the university.
example: apply'는 (일자리, 허가 등에) 공식적으로 '지원'하거나 '신청'한다는 의미, 혹은 (규칙/이론을) '적용하다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n You must apply for the position before the deadline.
sentence: You can ____ for the job online.

meaning: They appointed him (as) manager.
example: appoint'는 (어떤 사람을) 특정 직책이나 역할에 공식적으로 '임명한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The board decided to appoint Ms. Jane as the new director.
sentence: They will ____ a new leader next week.

meaning: The board approved the plan. / He doesn’t approve of violence.
example: approve'는 (계획, 요청, 예산 등을) 공식적으로 받아들이고 '승인한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The committee must approve the budget before we can proceed.
sentence: The board will ____ the final design.

meaning: She arranged a meeting. / He arranged for a taxi.
example: arrange'는 (미팅, 교통편, 일정 등을) 미리 계획하고 '준비'하거나 '마련한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n I will arrange a taxi to take you to the airport.
sentence: Let’s ____ a meeting for next Monday.

meaning: They assembled the parts. / People assembled in the hall.
example: assemble'는 (사람들이) 특정 목적을 위해 한곳에 '모이다' 혹은 (부품을) '조립하다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n All employees must assemble in the main hall for the presentation.
sentence: Workers will ____ in the main hall.

meaning: The committee assented to the proposal.
example: assent'는 (신중한 고려 후의) 공식적인 '동의'나 '승인'을 의미하는 명사입니다.\r\n The board of directors gave their assent to the merger proposal.
sentence: All members must ____ before starting.

meaning: They assessed the damage.
example: assess'는 (어떤 것의 가치, 품질, 중요성, 영향 등을) 판단하거나 '평가한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n We need to assess the impact of the new marketing campaign.
sentence: We need to ____ the risks carefully.

meaning: The teacher assigned homework to students.
example: assign'은 (특정 업무나 책임)을 누군가에게 맡기거나 '배정한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The manager will assign specific tasks to each team member.
sentence: The teacher will ____ each student a task.

meaning: He assisted her with the report.
example: assist'는 (누군가가 일을 더 쉽게 하도록) '돕는다'는 의미의 동사로, 'help'보다 격식 있는 표현입니다.\r\n Please let me know if I can assist you with your luggage.
sentence: I’ll ____ you with the report.

meaning: She assumed responsibility. / I assume that you agree.
partOfSpeech: 의미 따라 타동사(맡다) or 명사절 목적어.
example: assume'는 (새로운 책임이나 역할, 직책을) '떠맡는다'는 의미의 동사입니다. ('~라고 추정하다'는 뜻도 있음)\r\n Ms. Lee will assume the role of team leader starting next month.
sentence: Don’t ____ that he will agree with you.

meaning: Please attach the file to the email.
partOfSpeech: to + 대상 형태 고정. 수동형 빈출.
example: attach'는 (이메일에 파일을) '첨부하다' 혹은 (어떤 것을 다른 것에) '붙인다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n Please find the report attached to this email.
sentence: Please ____ the file to the email.

meaning: She attained her goal.
example: attain'는 (오랜 노력 끝에 높은 수준의 목표나 지위 등을) '성취'하거나 '이룬다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n He worked hard to attain the position of Senior Manager.
sentence: She managed to ____ her dream score.

meaning: He attended the meeting. / Please attend to the client.
example: attend'는 (회의, 수업, 행사 등에) '참석'하거나 '출석한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n All department heads are required to attend the quarterly meeting.
sentence: Few people ____ the conference every year.

meaning: The movie attracted many viewers.
example: attract'는 (사람들의 관심이나 흥미를) '끌어당기다' 혹은 (자석 등이) '끌어당기다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The company is trying to attract new customers with special promotions.
sentence: Good prices can ____ more customers.

meaning: He attributed the success to luck.
example: attribute'는 (어떤 사람이나 사물이 가진) 고유한 '특성', '자질', '속성'을 의미하는 명사입니다.\r\n Reliability is the most important attribute of our new product.
sentence: We often ____ success to hard work.

meaning: He avoided making the same mistake.
example: avoid'는 (불쾌하거나 원치 않는 일을) '방지'하거나 '피한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n To avoid extra charges please pay your bill on time.
sentence: Try to ____ eating too much sugar.

meaning: They awarded him a prize.
example: award'는 (심사 끝에 상이나 계약 등을) 공식적으로 '수여한다'는 의미의 동사입니다.\r\n The contract was awarded to the firm with the best proposal.
sentence: The company will ____ the best employee.
